name: Local Government Denmark
goal: LGDK is the interest organization and member authority of Danish municipalities. It is voluntary to be a member of LGDK, but nevertheless all 98 Danish municipalities are members. The mission of LGDK is to safeguard common interests of the municipalities, assist the individual municipality with consultancy services and in addition ensure that the local authorities are provided with up-to-date and relevant information.
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Borders and Security, Budget, Climate Action, Communication, Competition, Culture, Digital economy and society, Economy, finance and the euro, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Environment, Institutional affairs, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Public Health, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, Single market, Trans-European Networks, Youth
euInitiatives: Digital Single Market, E-government, Employment, Jobs and Growth, Data protection, Social dialog, Better regulation, Recycling and waste policy, Environment, New Skills Agenda, Youth initiative, Work life balance, social policy, circular economy, MFF
